Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laura S
Reviews.Content: After reading many bad reviews on here i was a little apprehensive, however i was very pleasantly surprised. the room was spacious, comfortable and clean, the location was brilliant close to the trevi fountain and next door to the hard rock cafe, which after a long day walking around caused us no sleep deprivation. The staff are extremely helpful and the breakfast is fresh and delicious. What more can I say?

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Bohdana Z
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel via booking.com and they've given us a very noisy room where you couldn't close a windows properly. So the third night I complained (I am not a trouble maker) that this is not what we expected and they were very helpful, they immediately moved us to the other room which was spacious and very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “SIMPLY SUPERB”
Reviews.Author: LondonBizler
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights last weekend during a visit to see friends in Rome. We had booked a Junior Suite but were upgraded on arrival to a Senior Suite, overlooking Via Veneto, which consisted of an enormous salon, an equally spacious bedroom and a beautiful bathroom - approximately 100 square metres in total! The hotel is old and classically stylish and does not pretend to be otherwise. However, it is kept spotlessly clean and we saw no sign of the 'wear and tear' that others seem to have experienced. Service is friendly and prompt with none of the condescension that other 'grand hotels' practice. We were being hosted by our friends so did not try out the restaurant. However, the breakfast buffet is substantial and delicious. The hotel has 2 passenger lifts and during 'rush hour', you may have to wait a couple of minutes but this is a minor detail. Overall, a great hotel and outstandingly good value.

Reviews.Title: “5* is really a 2* to be generous--HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: carpenter27060
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, I am currently staying at this hotel. I have never taken time to write a review in situ, but this is an exception. Outrageously decrepid and worn, the rooms while a decent size, are nothing more than basic--although the walls could use a few coats of paint to make them at least presentable. No extras, no plusses to note--no kettle, bathrobes, etc as well as no iron and if you want you are asked to pay for the service. This would be fine if all else was as is expected in a 5*, but this is just taking the mickey--crap, crap, crap in my opinion. When I asked to speak to the manager was told I would have to wait until tomorrow--fine, but once again in a 5* you expect service the same evening. There is no question that this is the worst hotel I have stayed in for several years--and I travel all around the world frequently for both work and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “A little faded but some very good points”
Reviews.Author: lewiseynon
Reviews.Content: We read some mixed reviews about this hotel and were a bit concerned before we went but overall we were very well treated and found it to be an excellent base for our first visit to this fantastic city. A short walk from Termini station and close by the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps we found this to be the perfect place from which to set out to visit all of the key sites we wanted to see in Rome - the Colosseum, Forum, Vatican and St Peter's and various museums - most notably Doria Pamphilj. The service was excellent - reception very efficient, breakfast staff very alert but not overattentive and cleaners and decorators (there were some) all willing to help when we looked a bit lost. We were given a quiet top floor room with a distant view of St Peter's basilica but the room looked jaded and the next day we asked to move. With no fuss (nor extra cost) our luggage was moved into a first floor room with a balcony overlooking the Via Veneto - noisier but the shutters kept most of that out at night and in the morning we knew we were in Rome. Breakfast offered everything we wanted from Parma ham and ricotta to bran flakes and granola. Good coffee. We didn't eat in the restaurant at night. Like everywhere along the Via Veneto it looked overpriced and, with the exception of the terrace, seemed likely to lack atmosphere - but we did not give it a chance. For our next visit we may choose somewhere a bit closer to the river but the Ambasciadori is well placed in a compact city and the care and attention of the staff helped to make up for its slightly faded character.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not 5*”
Reviews.Author: BellaH98
Reviews.Content: Me and my family had a great stay in rome this easter having stay at the Ambasciatori Plalace Hotel. This hotel is pretty average, clean, freindly but it doesn't live up to its five star rateting. The rooms i would give three star nice but abit old fashioned and in need of a refurb. However the onsuite toilet was lovely and big so i would gove that a 4 star. The breakfeast wasn't great so but it wasn't awful so i would probably give that a 3 star. The staff are very friendly and the consiure(can't spell it!) was great and allways went out of his was to help us. So overal i would give staff a 5*. I would allways buy food and drink out of the hotel because its very pricey. The hotel has 5* location though as we walked to all our attractions including the vatican and coloseum. The hotel was nice but the only reason i gave it 3* not 5 was beacause it is in need of a upgrade! Hope you enjoy your stay:)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leah B
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked this hotel through lastminute.com and it was a top secret hotel. Once the hotel details were revealed we were a little concerned upon reading the reviews on Tripadvisor. However, we were pleasantly surprised. Whilst there are some parts of the hotel I would consider 5*, overall I would rate it a 4*. Location: The hotel was in a very convenient location. A stroll down from Berberni Piazza (which had it’s own Metro) and Trevi fountain further down. Via Veneta was considered an expensive street to be on but we didn’t eat at any of the restaurants near the hotel. Next door to the hotel was Hard Rock Café – prices were at the usual European rates (9 euros for a beer!). There were many restaurants, bars and cafes along Via Veneta. It was a very central hotel but away from the over crowded areas. Hotel: A very impressive building with elaborate décor. The interior was very majestic-like. Front desk staff were polite enough but don’t expect a warm greeting. Hotel room: The hotel kindly upgraded us. We were given a room with a balcony over looking the front of the hotel – which was stunning. The room also included a seating area. The room was very clean (except one night blood was found on my boyfriend’s pillow. We were unable to confirm whether it was my boyfriend’s blood or whether the sheets had not been changed! A spare pillow was readily available in the cupboard though). The water pressure in the bath room was excellent and again very clean. Towels were warm and fluffy. And the beds were very comfortable. The décor in the room was a little tired and could do with being updated but overall we were happy with the room itself. Breakfast: The breakfast selection was wonderful. The variety of pastries and cakes on offer were just gorgeous. There was a small selection of hot food (bacon, eggs and sausages). Presentation was wonderful with attentive staff happy to assist.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable hotel, great sense of grandier even if a little shabby in spots...”
Reviews.Author: Christina68
Reviews.Content: From the reviews I had read I got exactly what I expected for myself, husband and 3 children. Great price and in great location. Our bedroom walls had dark patches of damp and damage on them and our shower leaked all over the bathroom, however our kids room which was opposite was gorgeous! When you get the internet bargains you generally get the worst rooms but for what we paid I would defintely go back again. TV remote didn't work and tv reception was pretty bad but we weren't in Rome to watch TV. The staff were really nice and kind to us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: biju_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 days and the atmosphere was very nice. For sure it's not a modern hotel, but with charme. Everything is close by, just walking distance from the main attractions. And also we did not pay so much, so I guess the price is worth the place. I would recommend for families and couples who does not like much the modern and cold style

Reviews.Title: “Birthday surprise”
Reviews.Author: DavidIreland41
Reviews.Content: The hotel was book at last minute on a special deal . The reception to the hotel is 5* with a friendly and warm welcome from the door staff and the reception staff. The rooms are a bit tired , and let the experience down , these are 3* at best. 4* when the fixtures and fittings were new but sadly they are 10-15years old and well used . The bed was comfortable and the room spacious , with internet access , table for lap top , plenty space for clothes and a large bathroom . The hotel does not have any self service ironing facilities. Ironing in the room is forbidden! There is a laundry service at 9euro per shirt . The bar and breakfast were very good , prices in the hotel bar compare with the other bars in Rome . Don't be shocked to pay 9 euro for a beer. This hotel is an average 4* hotel but a little dated in the quality of the fixtures and fittings. Location is excellent , 5min to the metro or a city tours bus . Numerous shops, cafes , around the hotel . Trevi fountain and the Spanish steps are with-in 10min walk . I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience.Belle epoque atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: IOANNIS p
Reviews.Content: We had buy the expedia unpublished rates offer. The price in comparison with the normal rates was very good (almost half) but the problem is that you lost this benefit because they give you in the hotel the worst room in a non rennovated annex (since is not profitable for the hotel). Ok i didn't expect a suite. Great location, great common facilities, great services and atmosphere, bad room, excellent bath and WC, good breakfast I suggest only for an offer price

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise !”
Reviews.Author: Miezie
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews of this hotel I had few expetations . However following an email from us requesting a " good " room we had a supberb junior suite with balcony & a view over the city including the Pantheon .. Service from the staff was excellent . Yes, the hotel is a little old in style& decor but charming. Our only complaint would be that niether mine, nor my husband's computer would connect - we were told " the problem is with you ! " . We would return here .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: DW1CoDown
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Ambasciatori Palace hotel last October before going on our cruise. It was a last minute deal and the price was extremely good for Rome, especially as I have been to Rome before paid much the same price for a just about average, small and pokey hotel. On arrival we were shown to a rooms! Yes, we had a nice and extremely spacious bedroom, bathroom and reception room with two balconies overlooking the front of the hotel, such a surprise! The hotel is excellently located in a 'good' area of Rome, the staff were so pleasant and helpful and a fantastic buffet breakfast was included in our overall price. The hotel decoration is slightly old fashioned and in keeping with its character which I enjoyed since I was in Rome and it was very clean. Overall, this was an excellent hotel, we would definitely stay there again without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Ambasciatore Palace, Rome”
Reviews.Author: K J
Reviews.Content: We booked the Ambasciatore Palace through the lastminute website, as a "mystery" top hotel, which lists it as a 5* hotel. It's not. If you pay the full price for this hotel, then of course you would be very disappointed, as it is nowhere near acceptable 5* standards (spa, great restaurant, gorgeous decor and a luxurious atmosphere), however as we spent a very reasonable amount for a weekend stay, it was perfectly fine. The location is great, a short walk to the Spanish steps, Trevi fountain (beautiful at night), shopping, and many beautiful little piazzas and cobbled streets. At the top of the street, Harry's bar though horrendously overpriced (70 euros for a very mediocre plate of fish), has nightly live music. The breakfast was not at all bad, plenty of pastries, cold meats and cereals, though terrible diluted juices and not much fruit. The room had shameful scoffed walls, and a very low bed, the windows looked out on to a street with a lap dancing club, so noisy if you keep the windows open at night. On the upside, a clean large bathroom, very obliging staff on the front desk as well as prompt room service. So, if you are going away to explore the delights of Rome, then this is ok. If it's a "stay-in-bed" kind of weekend, spend some more money and get a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “3 star if lucky”
Reviews.Author: mcjet
Reviews.Content: Booked one day before and got a good deal for 120 sterling inc breakfast. However, the hotel is faded and the room had the hardest bed ever, scuff marks on the walls and a minibar with a TV perched on top which felt as though was in a cheap bedsit. The room was quiet which was useful as we had to keep the window open because the room was boiling due to the central heating which couldn't be turned down. All in all I won't return as the hard bed and crazy temperature made it impossible to sleep. One saving grace was a very nice breakfast spread inc various juices, fruit salads, cereals, bacon, egg etc. They even had gluten free bread, which I very much appreciated. Staff were pleasant though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: beingval
Reviews.Content: Business trip to Rome. Great location, 10 mins walking from Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. Hotel need a bit of renovation, not sure it deservers the 5 stars. Great service and great buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but slightly faded for 5*”
Reviews.Author: owl1Uk
Reviews.Content: Superb welcoming service from every member if staff. Room including the bathroom was very spacious and clean. Bedroom fittings were outdated and slightly shabby. Breakfast was buffet style with a good selection. Hotel bar was expensive- as in all 5* hotels! Location was great for spanish steps and trevi fountain. Reception staff and concierge were very helpful providing free maps and information on sightseeing. We visited on a special weekend deal and would probably rate this 4*.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault it at all!”
Reviews.Author: mollieNorthEast
Reviews.Content: The reviews on TA were mixed so we had no expectations. We did e-mail the hotel before we left requesting adjoining rooms. On our arrival, which was early, we were immediately given our rooms on the 4th floor. To our surprise we were allocated interconnecting rooms, as there were 4 of us in the party. The rooms were very large, clean, slightly "shabby chic" with comfortable beds, and 2 balconies each ovelooking Via Veneto. The celings were very high making the rooms very airy. The bathrooms were clean, with minimal toiletries, one bathrobe (?) and one pair of slippers! There was a good hairdryer in the bathroom also. The heating was extremely effective but as the weather was so warm (about 12 -14c) we turned it off. The noise level was high when balcony doors were open but when closed we could hardly hear it. The buffet breakfast was lovely with fruit, cereal, juices, breads, cakes, meats,cheeses etc. and you could eat as much as you wanted. The dining-room was very comfortable if a bit old-fashioned. We got a deal for this hotel using lastminute.com and it was excellent value. However, I would not like to pay full price for this hotel as it is not 5* in comparison to 5* hotels in Ireland. It could do with a huge makeover to bring it up to 5* standard but left as it is it is more of a 4* However, having said that we could not fault any aspect of this hotel. Staff were more than helpful. Hotel is in perfect location being about 10 mins. walk to the Trevi fountain, Spanish Steps and little further to the Pantheon. Day two we walked from the hotel to the Coleseum, up along the Tiber to St. Peter's Square and back to the hotel by metro. We found a lovely restaurant close to the Trevi Fountain and we ate there both nights. We were blessed that he weather was so good for our stay and also we felt safe at all times walking the streets around the hotel. I would recommend this hotel to friends without hesitation particularly if they got a good deal on it. We were very happy with our choice and our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Redressing the balance a bit”
Reviews.Author: David N
Reviews.Content: I was very worried after reading many of the reviews here for the Ambasciatori Palace. I took the advice of one reviewer and emailed them before arrival, saying I had rad some poor reviews and was slightly worried - expressing desire for a good room. I have to say that the room was a good size with a huge comfortable bed (bit firm but I like that). We had arrived long before the normally permitted check in time expecting to drop the bags and come back later - but we were immediately made welcome and given our room straight away. The staff were nothing but helpful. Comments have been made about the noisy location - but hey - this is Via Veneto after all - home of La Dolce Vita, it is a district where there is a certain amount of "life" - which is why you would stay there in the first place! And yes, it is over the Hard Rock Cafe. We were on the second floor at the front of the hotel and the noise is noticeable with the bedroom window open - but NOT if the window is closed. We are used to total absence of noise living with no neighbours on a quiet country lane - we ourselves can't sleep if noisy - we experienced NO noise issues with a closed bedroom window. The room had air-con with a slightly noisy fan if turned up high so we kept it on low. The buffet breakfast was fine and as much as you want to eat you can eat. We didn't eat in the hotel at other times preferring the small restaurants in the area. Harry's Bar at the top of the street exceedingly over-priced and very average food, stick to the restaurants in he side streets and it is excellent. OK - true - it isn't five star in the top London hotel league, but my wife and I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again and recommend it to friends. For the lastminute.com special offer pricing it is nothing short of superb. Top tip - buy tickets for one of the hop-on, hop-off open topped bus services. The Colliseum, Forum, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain are all easy walks from the hotel - but the bus service is good for interesting facts, getting to the Vatican / Castel San Angelo and getting around oher shopping areas!

Reviews.Title: “Watch your valuables”
Reviews.Author: 769AdrienneJ769
Reviews.Content: Our first impressions of the hotel were good, with a well appointed triple room and an excellent location. When our money was stolen from our locked hotel room during breakfast at the hotel, our impression changed drastically. Our room had been cleaned during our absence and the maid left the door open during cleaning therefore no one could be held responsible for the theft. We went straight to reception and explained what had happened and basically they told us we should have locked our handbags in the safe and we should go to the police to file an insurance claim. Would never stay here again - theft from a locked room leaves you feel very unsafe!

Reviews.Title: “Phantom of the opera”
Reviews.Author: HedonistLondon
Reviews.Content: Dear oh dear.... Booked a "top secret hotel" with lastminute.com and learned two lessons in one go: never again at this hotel and never again a booking blind folded. This hotel appears to be a grand old dame with emphasis on old. Stuffy, slow motion approach of a Fellini movie. I do wonder why Cunard uses it for their cruise passengers. The hotel makes it very clear that they are a five star establishment. I can only wonder what is the bench mark - but surely it is none of the true five star hotels next door. I stayed in room 610 and be warned: the outdoor spaces around the room are neglected, untidy, lack security as anyone can enter your terrace space and have a very loud a/c unit in the corner - noise entering the room without any problems. No wireless, wired internet attached to the tv unit with no desk space available = useless for business traveller. Breakfast room was another minus. Juice selection was a number of artificial juices with no link to fresh produce. Service slow and front of house manager simply rude (talk to the hand gestures allover the place) and inefficient relic of yesteryear. During my last evening next door a/c went mental. Front desk promised to fix it, but never did. Off to another room. Interesting enough this room came with bathrobes and turndown. It appears that rooms booked with a deal come with a worse deal in terms of level of standard and service. Before departure I shared my concerns with the duty manager and I was promised a response from the management. That is now almost three months ago. Italians sometimes do take their time, but I do not expect to hear from this hotel anymore. Nor will I stay there either.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money... only if on a special offer”
Reviews.Author: James A
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, I got what I paid for and was generally satisfied but this was only because it was a "top secret hotel" at a cut price £100 - 120 per night. Had I paid full rate I would have been outraged. The reception area is very impressive- all marble, sweeping staircase and oil paintings. However there was nobody to open the door for us, the receptionist was surly and there wasn't even a suggestion that our bags would be taken up to the room for us- just a stubby finger pointing towards the lift. The room itself was nicely proportioned with tall ceilings and comfortable bed... but in desperately in need of a lick of paint. There were black scuff marks from suitcases / shoes covering the walls, with plasterwork chipped from the angles. The bathroom was also huge with lovely thick marble tiles... but again there were damp marks on the ceiling and the shower leaked. There were also little inattentive quirks like complimentary slippers being provided but only 1 pair for the 2 of us. Also, after an early start (for 6.10am flight!) we settled down for an early night at about 11pm... although at about 11.25pm we were disturbed by hoovering just outside our room. The man looked utterly bewildered when I asked if he would stop- he did without complaint- I assume they were closing the restaurant and he was cleaning up but vacuum cleaning at nearly midnight in a hotel?! Breakfast was good and service was friendly. I didn't try any of the hotel's offerings for lunch or dinner, although the continental lack of kettle in the room meant €10 splurged on two cups of tea from the comfortable bar. The location of the hotel is very good- nicely central but Via Veneto is not the idyllic boulevard it was (certainly in those old films) a few years ago. Think more busy dual carriageway. I would advise you to ask for a room facing the back rather than the front. The noise wasn't loud enough to disturb us but you could hear it, particularly at night. So overall, I would recommend this hotel if you get a good price for it and are using it just as a place to bed down for the night- not a place you are going to spend any time in. If you are a someone who likes to spend some time relaxing in your hotel, try the nearby Eden or Hassler. You'll spend more money but get the real 5* experience.

Reviews.Title: “Rome and this Hotel in November is ideal”
Reviews.Author: willentine1
Reviews.Content: Took Airport shuttle to the Hotel door - cheaper and cost much less than using train /metro / taxi.Lovely swift journey showing a glimpse of the beautiful lush countryside. Hotel immaculate and Staff very friendly -Traditional Italian decor and service - great location only minutes walk from Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps - for those who need more global influence it is also next door to American themed Hard Rock cafe Restaurant. Room was large and well kept including larger than king size bed in grand well fitted room with traditional oppulant marble en- suite. Breakfast was excellent - choice of cold and hot buffet self served but attended very agreeable staff in a very bright with optional open veranda area. Weekend trip - we flew around walking or on the open top buses - so well organised and in our opinion the fastest and most efficient way of seeing the whole city at speed. Return journey to airport was by train from the Terminni central station - easy to buy tickets and negotiate platforms. Rome is amazing and to go in November we were lucky to have sunny days and not too chilly evenings - the wine and food choice is brilliant. Every turn in Rome has a spectacular wow factor - too many to mention - we found no fault and will return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Trading on past glories”
Reviews.Author: rocketmanBRU
Reviews.Content: 5-star facade, 5-star prices, but nothing else warrants a 5-star rating! Poor service right from the get-go when the doorman can't be bothered to hold the door for us as we struggle out of cab and through the hotel door with our luggage. Then the desk staff can barely bother to check us in, at least not until they can finish their private conversation. The lobby and public reception rooms look nice, but the hotel rooms - while large - are furnished with shabby, uncomfortable, sparse furniture that I wouldn't even expect in a 3-star hotel. We were on the interior courtyard, room uncomfortably hot (AC goes off, heat goes on on 1 November no-matter what the actual weather) but opening the window to cool/circulate air brings in the aroma of the restaurant kitchen. 1995 cathode-ray tube television was probably adding a few degrees of heat to the room too. The room was fairly clean, with the exception of the bath non-skid mat that was black with mold. Housekeeping did replace this promptly after I raised the problem to the front desk, but really in a 5-star these sorts of things shouldn't make it past quality assurance! Breakfast buffet was completely disappointing, basic scrambled eggs congealing in a serving dish, and pastries and assorted watery reconstituted juices. Absolutely no attempt to cook to order anything. At least coffee was promptly delivered to the table. Wired internet only in rooms at exorbitant 15E/day, or free wireless if you perch on one of the few chairs in the small lobby or small 'internet point' room. All things considered, this hotel is trading on past glories, and simply doesn't warrant the 5-stars they advertise, or the prices they charge.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bug warning”
Reviews.Author: David7797
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in October 2011 and had a room on the top floor. For 2 nights we were bitten to death by bed bugs, I had over 25 bites, my wife had 15. The hotel moved us to another room (magnificent, best on the hotel), but refused to make any refund for the 2 nights in the bug infested room. On return to the UK I complained in writing, but all we were offered was a room upgrade next time we visited. Apart from this, the hotel is OK, but certainly not 5 star. The bar and restaurant are very expensive

Reviews.Title: “Short stay Ambasciatori Palace”
Reviews.Author: drugal
Reviews.Content: I only stayed at the Hotel for one night and I must say that I have mixed feelings about it. The location, staff, cleanliness and breakfast cannot be faulted (although perhaps not quite up to full 5 Star standard). The room was disappointing (even by 3 Star standards) but then the bathroom was massive and luxurious! Since I got the room at a very reduced price and also considering the short lenght of stay I was happy but had I paid the full price and stayed for a longer period then I would have probably inisisted in getting a better room or looked for another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Location and A Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sackbut58
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location within Central Rome, with the main railway station a 10 minute walk away and the main tourist attractions within reasonable walking distance. The hotel itself is perhaps slightly faded from it's original grandeur, but we had no issues with staying here. The staff were efficient and friendly, while the room was large and very clean. Although the bedroom itself was rather plain, the bathroom appeared to have been recently upgraded and was excellent. Our room was located on the inside, overlooking the central well - so no view, but on the plus side, very quite, with no traffic noise at all. The buffet breakfast was very good. Overall, we would be very happy to stay at this hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: RABTunbridgeWells
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a trip for my husband's 40th birthday. Whilst the entrance to the hotel was lovely, the room was a slightly better than 3* and very disappointing given the price. The two gentlemen on the front desk were very friendly but the one thing we asked their help with (booking tickets for the Vatican) they couldn't do and directed us towards the hotel computers which were very slow and frustrating - we had to abandon attempts on the first evening and try very early the next morning. So, again, not 5 star on that front either. The breakfasts were good - not bad, not amazing. The location was good although I might recommend somewhere more in the middle of all the attractions if you are planning to walk around Rome which is entirely possible and probably recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but yes not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: jqworle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and having read the previous reviews we were a bit sceptical about what we would get, though i have an unwritten rule that if it is in the top 25% of all reviews it mainly works out fine. Our room 521 was huge it even had a balcony with table and chairs over looking the Via Veneto it was well maintained and the bathroom was also extremely large with a bath and separate shower, the breakfast was fine and location was great though as others have reported the road noise is quite intrusive but hey this is a city and you are on a main road so it comes with the territory.The room was very warm but leaving the window open dropped the temp quite quickly.The hard rock cafe next door was also handy as it had cheaper beer and wine than the rather expensive hotel bar. This was another of lastminute.com specials and yes they do need to change the offer as this is not 5 star more like 3-4, but on the whole we would stop there again if we could guarantee the same room.

Reviews.Title: “stop saying this is a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: liza l
Reviews.Content: i can not say this is a 5 star hotel but in rome they dont care. on arival we were told we had to pay 3 euros per person per day new italian tax . we are not from italy not interested ???/ we paid before we left. thay should tell the agent!!! day of arivel no hot water. 2nd day out return at 3 to find room had not been cleaned.. rang desk dont no why ????????? breakfast good but as i speak italian i dont want to listen to staff problems !!!! last minute needs to look at this hotel we had a stain down the wall .but the hotel needs to stop thinking that we are going to put up with these standers. not a happy stay . simple dont go.

Reviews.Title: “5* - when was that? Roman Times?”
Reviews.Author: Brooke1403
Reviews.Content: I really feel let down after staying here. e booked through Last Minute.com as their 5* luxury choice - oh dear. Rooms faced the rear of the hotel - both enjoyed views and sounds of the bin lorry collecting after midnight. The double was stifling with the air conditioning turned off in the whole hotel. The single was very small and you could listen to the next door room having a shower as it was the other side of the wall. but with a decent bathroom (no bath). Both rooms were clean but had aged TV's with little UK content. Breakfast - awful - watered down juice, stale muffins and just an ordinary selection of everything else. We travel quite a bit and struggle to remember when it was that poor. Lifts are now big enough for the size of the hotel. This feels like a hatchet job and maybe it is. Frankly just avoid if you are in anyway used to 4/5* hotels as you will be disappointed. Reception is nice and the staff on the whole do their best. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled”
Reviews.Author: JLW_9
Reviews.Content: The hotel is shabby and at best 3 star, making even a lastminute"top secret" purchase seem expensive. Our room at the "quieter" part of the hotel in fact had a nightclub on the other side of the road thus even with earplugs we were unable to sleep until it closed at 3.30am. The room was poor with the shower hanging off the wall and generally in dire need of new furniture and a lick of paint. Breakfast was OK but with limited choice (except the fruit which was excellent) we experienced excessive waits for a table and then surly waiting staff who you had to try and catch to obtain such essentials as cutlery and cups. All in all I would not recommend this hotel you can get much better in Rome for your money, particularly if you value sleep and courteous service!

Reviews.Title: “Via Veneto, quiet and central.”
Reviews.Author: HKYassa
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs serious refurbishing to deserve 5 Star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the lobby fool you.”
Reviews.Author: AJ G
Reviews.Content: The lobby is grand, like an old movie, the rooms gross, like a 70's cop show. The bed springs poke you through the mattress, the carpets are dirty, garage sale furniture and drapes throughout and the place smells like smoke. Not sure why they don't paint the and make a trip to Ikea for new furniture, this would solve 1/2 the problem. They could then replace the 1999 vintage TV and maybe get WiFi or at least not charge you 15 Euro for slow wired internet. Power went out a few times and one day we had no hot water. There is no coffee in the hotel before 7:15 when room service starts and if you park a car be sure they charge you correctly. The service seemed to be an exercise in finding new methods and explanations for saying no. We asked for an out facing room weeks in advance and confirmed a few days in advance and then the day of. Of course this was not accommodated. Over all this is a sad hotel. It may have once been great but no longer. They should market as a three start hotel and if you are using Priceline or Hotwire beware.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kat_2425
Reviews.Content: This hotel is supposed to be a 5star, however this is not the case, more 3-4...Saying that, it entirely met our needs, was in a fantastic location-5 minute walk from the metro station and a 15 minute walk away from the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. The shower was fantastic, although it leaked onto the floor.. That's the only complaint I would make. Staff were friendly and helpful and the buffet breakfast was delicious (they even had soy milk, so I was happy!!). I'd stay here again :-)

Reviews.Title: “My wife loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: eugenemcmanus
Reviews.Content: booked on last minute mystery hotel, When i read the reviews on the hotel i was slightly concerned, Alas my concerns were unfounded, my wife loved the ambience of the hotel and i would also compliment the staff who were very helpful on every occassion. Personally speaking the hotel is dated but in saying that our room was clean and was also cleaned every day. Bathroom could have had its tiles grouted,we missed the tea and coffee making facility in our room but we had the hard rock cafe next door. Overall verdict pretty good. I would warn tourists to be careful regarding taxi's in rome, there are many conn taxi drivers especially around the main bus station in central rome so be careful several of our friends were overcharged by several taxi drivers. We used taxis quite a lot when in Rome, any taxi we ordered from our hotel was excellent charged the correct ammount, I would advise any one ordering a taxi to be extra careful and let the resturant or hotel you are in to order it.

Reviews.Title: “3 nights at the ambasciatori palace”
Reviews.Author: JulieA2508
Reviews.Content: Booked this on last minute.com, so identity was not revealed until purchased. Is graded as a 5 star hotel, reading other reviews would have to agree that this is not 5 star, 4 star at best. The rooms were shabby, needed painting very badly, my bathroom was throwback from the 70s. The breakfast buffet although an abundant supply, lacked quality and a bit of insight into varied tastes for breakfast. However the staff were very friendly and very helpful and responded quickly to any queries and requests. The location is very good, within walking distance of Spanish steps and Trevi fountain. It is right next door to the Hard Rock Cafe, which would appear to sell the most reasonably priced wine in Rome. With some paint and a bit of effort, is all that it would take to restore this hotel to it's former glory.

Reviews.Title: “The real deal on Ambasciatori Palace Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Planetekarl
Reviews.Content: You've read the reviews and still can't make up your mind on the Ambasciatori Palace Hotel? Here's the real deal. Let's start with the positive. Service is excellent. We were greeted and treated like royalty. The location is great: close to restaurants, small shops and a subway station, and far enough to be in a calm area. Breakfast is also included which is a plus. For the rest, this is not a new hotel and should be expected as such. We visited two rooms and chose one that haden't been renovated for its italian charm. Rooms are clean and have air conditioning. Is this place a 4.5 star? No. Is it a good place to stay in Rome? Yes. We will stay here again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Aug 1- 3 2011 Ambasciatori Palace Hotel”
Reviews.Author: iancSurrrey
Reviews.Content: Found as everyone did its a 4 not 5 in some respects. Rooms; they are big, and like the property old but clean & quiet (and I had a view of the pole dancing joint). However I found the staff great. You treat them correctly they are good to you (unlike I may say the fool who was shouting away at the front desk as I was leaving). Breakfast and breakfast room with terrace great way to start the day. If you dont like anything heres a tip- the boss eats there every morning reading his papers. For me It was good value for money but I booked well ahead. Location is great. Via Venetto as a whole and Rome in general is very overpriced but thats Rome. Where else can you walk amongst so many marvellous sites in an hour or 2. Nowhere.

Reviews.Title: “past glory”
Reviews.Author: doini
Reviews.Content: the impression is of an old rich lady , with a poor make up some parts. as if the hotel survives from his past glory. many art object of certain value as decoration , but don't expect genuine 5 stars. visited 3 rooms ," dusty " baroque , those old tapestry have nothing in comun with luxury . by contrary , grand bahrooms . rooms facing via venetto noisy .satisfying breakfast , helpful and profesional personnel. don't regret the experience. but wish not come again.

Reviews.Title: “No five star, not really a bad hotel, but don't pay five star prices, not worth it.”
Reviews.Author: SomeWorkSomePlay
Reviews.Content: Strange hotel, massive rooms, the biggest I have ever stayed in. Nice bathrobes. Terribly rough bedsheets, like sandpaper. Service pretty good by Italian standards (still woefully inadequate by North American standards). Breakfast buffet and room one of the better continental spreads we saw across Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: peter T
Reviews.Content: Like many I was a concerned having read the reviews on trip adviser regarding this Hotel, But we were more than pleasantly surprised when we arrived at this Hotel... It was wonderful, Bright and clean...ideally positioned in one of the better locations in Rome close to local underground and only a half mile walk from the local train station... We had booked this Hotel through Last minute as a secret Hotel. The staff were polite , pleasant and very helpful... we booked the basic twin room with bathroom and found it met our needs admirably... The price that we had paid included breakfast, which was served in the first floor restaurant which has a small terrace that looks along the via veneto, Breakfast was amazing all you could eat, the staff were incredibly helpful ....... our room also included a turn down service........ we would certainly book this Hotel again....... Book with confidence....... It would be very difficult to find fault with this Hotel.... if I had to find fault with this Hotel or its location then we would only make a few comments.... The Hotel is positioned adjacent to The Hard Rock Cafe... which for us was a plus not a negative their £10 burger is fantastic and great value for money...... also our shower screen in the bathroom leaked water onto the floor if you took extended time in the shower...... we saw none of these as a negative... A great Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for what we paid - which certainly wasn't full price!”
Reviews.Author: December_1982
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful from the outside, as was the main lobby but once you got into the main area of the hotel (hallway and room) the decor was dated and a little shabby. The reception staff were very helpful, as were the catering staff at breakfast. The decor in the restaurant was a little dated and shabby but the food was plentiful and delicious. Our room was comfortable, and had what you'd expect from a 3 or 4 star hotel - although no sofa/easy chairs; and the bed was huge - over 6ft wide! The bathroom was where we were let down: the tile grout was mouldy, the bath was a jet whirlpool type but the jets were grubby and so I didn't dare turn them on, and finally the door trim was peeling away from the frame as if it had been flooded. The hotel is near some lovely little street side restaurants which are quite expensive; head to the Piazza Navona for real value for money, authentic home cooked food. It's a little walk into the main shopping and tourist attraction areas but no more than a 15 minute amble.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star? Not a chance!”
Reviews.Author: MrsCupcake02
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through last minute.com for our two night honeymoon in Rome. Promised a 5 star hotel etc before booking and were very excited. We enjoy staying in nice hotels and did not book this time on a whim as it was such a special occasion. This hotel is not, under any circs, a 5 star hotel. The room was VERY basic indeed. Large but very basic. The room had very scratched laminate flooring in it and walls that were short of a good paint. There are no brew facilities and unbelievebly no iron and ironing board (a 7 euro charge for somebody to iron for you!) Our room was at the front of the building so the noise of traffic was terrible and woke us both early on both mornings. To make things worse, the curtains would not shut so early morning light disturbed us too. The bathroom wasn't too bad but again NOwhere to the standard of a 5 star. There is also a 5 euro charge to use the internet for one hour. The staff were polite enough to be fair. On our last day we could not open the safe on the code that we had entered and it was sorted within half an hour. Breakfast was ok, and again the staff very polite etc. There is a variety - sausage, bacon and egg, cereal, yoghurts, cakes, juices, coffee. The breakfast area is clean enough if not a little tired. Location is good, near the metro and walking distance to Trevi Fountain. Would we stay there again? No.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location--Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Darien2011
Reviews.Content: All in all, the hotel was good for us. We stayed 7 nights. Our room was large and it had a balcony that overlooked the front of the hotel. I liked the fact that the US Embassy is literally next door to the hotel. We walked everywhere--the central location made it easy. Vincenzo, the concierge, was a nice guy who set up all our tours. The breakfast, contrary to other reviews I read, was great. I looked forward to it every morning. Great service, and excellent coffee and great food. I really felt the staff of the hotel worked hard to make our stay comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5-star, but decent”
Reviews.Author: Esthili
Reviews.Content: Pros: location, breakfast, friendly kitchen staff, room size good Cons: not overly clean, definitely not five star

Reviews.Title: “We think it's doable...”
Reviews.Author: spotmenow
Reviews.Content: booked the hotel before reading the reviews and was really afraid afterwards because of so many bad reviews. Yes, the room's decor is very 70's but the bed is comfortable, the a/c works (could it be because we wrote a few days prior to arrival to inquire for a comfortable room? who knows!).... Location is perfect. A short 5-10 minutes walk to the Spanish Steps (Piazza di Spagna)... Near Barberini bus stop and a good 20-30 minutes walk from the central Roma Termini. With what we paid, if we could repeat, we would. However we wouldn't stay there again if they increased the rate (paid €89/night) unless of course they update the room. Got a glance to the updated room, looks really nice. The only drawback is that they need to put a shower curtain in the shower so water won't splash everywhere...

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: AzzFournier81
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked this holiday with lastmin.com as a surprise for my 30th birthday. Just before we went i looked up the hotel on here and saw its mixed reviews. I decided to email them to make sure we had a decent room as it was for such a special occasion. We were given a lovely comfortable room. Very clean and tidy hotel. Staff were beyond helpful at recommending places to visit - that only a Roma citizen would know. But what clinched it was that they heard I was turning 30 when I was there and when we got back to our room there was a bottle of prescco in our room with compliments from the manager! So sweet. Really made it a special trip! We had an amazing trip - thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Not worthy of a Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: nickijags
Reviews.Content: Lesson learned: always listen to Trip Advisor! When so many people posted that this hotel was run down and far from 5 star, we should have ran into the Pallatine Hills! The Ambascatori was horrid from the moment we arrived. Nothing about this place is 5 star. It looks like it might have been nice....in the 1950s. The room was dark and dreary. No style or personality. The sheets and towels were like sand paper. The TV was from the 1990s. Worse, service was nonexistent: we had booked a Vatican tour with the hotel weeks earlier but no one ever bothered to leave us the information. We had to chase down the concierge- who works maybe 2 hours a day. And most importantly: the DO NOT DISTURB sign is hidden in the binder describing the hotel. We didn't find it until the 3rd day - and up til that point, we were woken up by the cleaning staff barging in every single morning around 8am. I talked to other people in the elevator/lobby who had the same problem- and never found their DO NOT DISTURB card. In a city of wonderful, charming hotels, look elsewhere. This place is not worth the money- even when it was on-sale. We would also never stay on the Via Veneto again. This was the 3rd time that I have stayed in this area and it was a mistake: the Via Veneto is touristy and overpriced. And lacks the real charm of one of the Eternal City.

Reviews.Title: “Superb staff and location”
Reviews.Author: Scampbellemuffy
Reviews.Content: Very central and excellent staff. Spacious rooms but a bit dated. Crazy prices in hotel bar. 125 ml of white wine (1/6th of wine bottle) was 10 euro, coke 8 euro. And a shot of ordinary scotch johny walker red was 12 euro! Very helpful staff at reception and congierge. Actually all staff every where were excellent

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5star...”
Reviews.Author: boss099
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night. Acutally, this is not a 5 star hotel. The lobby area is nice, but that's it. Old fashion room with a terrible bed. (Very hard bed!) Breakfast was aslo a big disappointment, few things to choose. No omelets, far ways from a 5 star breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “We said we would be back and we did just that”
Reviews.Author: genebeans
Reviews.Content: My wife and I ended up in a real bad hotel and did not check in but were stranded and I called Ambasciatori and got Sylvia on the phone and she got us a three night stay at a very fair price. We had room 131 this time and it was quiet and re-done and very clean. Whenever we called for anything such as towels they were delivered immediately.Breakfast has actually in quality improved as we remember it.-I agree that this is a strong 4-star and not a five star as there is no turn down at night or pool and there seems to be many convention meetings going on but they don,t disturb anyone. We enjoyed it again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible dark miserable bedroom and disgusting bathroom”
Reviews.Author: lolberg
Reviews.Content: Booked this "Secret Hotel " on Last Minute Dot Com which erroneously advertised this as a "Five Star" Hotel . Should be rated as Two Star. Hotel lobby satisfactory but rest dark and univiting. Bedroom can only be called disgusting with dirty fabric wallpaper, bathroom had cracked toilet seat, mould filled grouting and sink coming away from the wall. Might be sensible for agency who misleadingly tell you how wonderful their hotels are to actually take the time to check out the Hotels they work with before putting them on their web site.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: susan11111
Reviews.Content: After we had already paid in full for our 6 day stay, I read some bad reviews which made me very anxious. I e-mailed the hotel and told them about the bad reviews and my anxiety and asked them if I could at least have a comfortable bed! We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived and were greeted warmly at the front desk of the beautiful lobby. The gentleman who checked us in said "I am upgrading your room"! The hotel is very elegant and the staff could not have been more helpful. We had a very large corner room with a king sized bed and many tall windows and a balcony off of each. There were two couches and a desk and a mirrored armoire with plenty of room for clothing. The beautiful marble bathroom came equipped with a magnifying mirror, hair dryer, robe, lots of shampoo, bath foam etc. The tub was narrow and deep, great for relaxing in after walking for miles each day! The breakfast offered something for everyone, a vast variety of food and we could eat on the terrace if we wished. The wi-fi is free in the lobby, you have to pay by the hour in your room. There is a very nice bar in the lobby and lots of comfortable seating in various rooms of the large lobby. The location was perfect, right next to Barberini Plaza and across the street from the American Embassy,very convenient and classy. We miss the hotel and would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Hugely Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Skicrazed
Reviews.Content: Despite glowing reviews by others, our experience was the opposite. The exterior appointments and lobby of the hotel were consistent with its 4-star rating. however, the rooms were not. Our room was not ready when we arrived and we were shoehorned into a small room lest we wait "a couple of hours" until the chambermaid got to it. The room was ugly, old and cheap looking (although the bathroom was nice). The service was poor - arrogant, condescending and almost rude, as if we were an inconvenience. We are low maintenance travelers. Still we were always polite in order to get anything done. The internet did not work. The continental breakfast was horrible - the 'American coffee" was undrinkable and we are not coffee snobs. Dinner at the hotel was bad - the steak was undercooked and tasted like styrofoam. 4-star hotel? I don't think so. We've stayed at 2-star hotels that were better than this. A one-star is more like it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, will definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: KayKay012
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel we were pleasantly surprised!! As with all the hotels on Via Veneto the Ambasciatori Palace is a beautiful old building very elegant and impressive. The style/furnishings within the hotel are typically Italian and what I would describe as 'old school glamour'. Most of the hotels on this road are rated 5* and are pretty similiar in style and decor. This hotel is brilliantly placed for walking to the Trevi fountain, the spanish steps, Via Condotti and the Pantheon within 10 mins. The Vatican is 2 stops from the underground station Barberini which is at the end of the road. The hotel is spotlessly clean and the the staff are wonderful!! Anna-lisa who greeted us at reception ensured that our stay was both comfortable and enjoyable. She had arranged for us to be upgraded to a marvellous room with an outside terrace. The room we stayed in was absolutely beautiful, lots of space with extremely comfortable beds! The Concierge Enzo is a real gent! A larger than life character (was trained and worked at the Savoy in London for 15 years) who is happy to answer any questions and really goes out of his way to assist you. Enzo and Gaetano (the other concierge) recommended some great restaurants for us to go to, they were a fountain of knowledge which really added to our trip! What really makes this hotel is the staff not to mention the magnificent breakfast!! Check out time is usually 11.00am but due to our 8pm flight back to London they were more than happy for us to check out at 2.30pm. Rome is a beautiful city and two days just wasn't long enough! I'm planning on going again and when I do the Ambasciatori Palace is where I'll be staying! BTW this hotel for us was value for money having got a discounted rate through last minute.com. Please be aware not all bedrooms have been refurbished. It's worth asking for a recently refurbished room when making your booking.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Gawdy
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel under the 'Top Secret" section of Last Minute.com and having used this service before were fairly confident the hotel would be good. It may once have been 5* but this is definitely no longer the case, the hotel is tired and in need of refurbishment. We changed room on arrival as the spa bath must have been the first ever spa bath , its fittings were black and broken. We were offered another room straight away, which was smaller but at least we could use the bath with confidence, however, the air conditioning was broken. The following morning we were given a third room, this was lighter than the other rooms, the bathroom was ok but the safe was broken.All rooms were clean but not what we had expected. The staff were all very helpful and pleasant. Breakfast was average and served with enthusiasm. Would I stay again? Probably not unless I had a special deal. I would have been very upset if I had paid the full rate for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Jo_Red_9
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a fair few 5 star hotels in Europe , and was a bit worried about the mixed reviews. But was very pleased I decided to stay here. We found it very difficult to find a triple room in a 5* hotel on the internet (might have had more success if we'd emailed some of them). The 3rd bed was a put-me-up, but it had a proper matress which was very comfortable to sleep on. The main bed was also very comfortable. The room size was excellent for 3 people, a nice large bathroom with a powerful shower over a bath. TV, mini bar, and reasonably priced Internet connection. The decor was fine and very efficient air conditioning, The maid did a wonderful job (thanks Maria), and the room was cleaned to a high standard . Due to the republic parade the hotel was very busy, but the room was quiet and we didnt hear corridor noise. Breakfast was self service, a good selection of cold meats , cheese etc and hot eggs, bacon and sausage. and lots of lovely pastries. The staff were efficient with supplying coffee etc and all spoke very good English (not like my Italian!). There are many lovely restaurants around the hotel, very reasonably priced for the area, but made their money on the alcohol. Walking distance - Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain and main clothes shopping. Would recommend an open topped bus to see the city and get to Vatican and Colloseum, the most we saw were for the blue Ciao Roma buses (bit disappointed with the wait for the red City Sightseeing buses, was alot longer than the 20 minutes advertised). Taxi from airport was fixed 40 euro.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, average amenities”
Reviews.Author: trailtramp
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights for work. The room's furnishings were outdated, although I did have a very nice, large bathroom. The bedroom had a tiny TV and a very short wire to connect (for the expensive fee you have to pa) for the internet that came out of the TV - i.e. no desk to put your lap top on to be able to work - totally impractical. The breakfast was good, but had to wait for a table. The business center ( a small corner with a desk-top computer) was mediocre at best. Apart from the lack of amenities for the business traveller, my biggest complaint was the surly attitude of the reception and bar staff who were unfriendly and seemed to have the attitude that guests should consider it a privilege to speak with them.

Reviews.Title: “Not a five star hotel - trapped in the 80's!”
Reviews.Author: LauraP186338
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ambasciatori Palace in May this year and it was quite an odd experience. It was described as a five star hotel and I can only think that it obtained this rating in the 1980s and nobody has checked since! When we arrived there was only one man on reception who was busy shouting down the phone at an unsuspecting customer. This was our experience every time we went to reception and we would suggest it might be better to put the phone in the back office. Every time we asked for something it seemed to get passed through 3 or 4 members of staff which wasn't very efficient. Having said that although they were disorganised the staff were very pleasant. The room itself was like being in a timewarp. There was an old-fashioned TV balanced on top of a faux wood electrolux fridge, the room looked like it hadn't been decorated since the 80s. However, the room was large, comfortable and clean. Breakfast was a very odd experience. The staff were dressed in strange red and gold jackets with black trousers (a bit like fawlty towers). Quite a strange selection of food but they did have Prosecco so it wasn't all bad! Overall it was a reasonable hotel, I'd describe it as a 3-4 star hotel rather than a 5 star one, it could do with a refurbishment to bring it into the present decade.

Reviews.Title: “Badly needs an Upgrade”
Reviews.Author: madmax25000
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here with my wife. It is a fine hotel but not 5* by any account. Its service is maybe within the 5* however the general decor etc needs a good clean up thus leaving in the the mid 4 * range. ( some would say old world charm, I would say tired) The rooms are a good size but again the secor lets the hotel down and the beds are old and springy. The bathroom however was a quality 5* finish in a lovely pink marble with all amenieties available. There were 2 sinks and 2 showers and a bath. ( See photos) on a positive note, the staff are more that helpful and the service is attentive. Breakfast was a little messy but we were seated within minutes of arriving and the selection of food is excellent. Would I stay here again ? Yes and no.... Yes due to the location with is fantastic but I'd have get a good deal to stay here, if the prices were on par with a 4* hotels I'd stay however if they were on par with a 5* no is the answer. Would I recommend the hotel....Yes if you get a good deal - v - a 5*

Reviews.Title: “Vary varied quality rooms from very good to awful!”
Reviews.Author: GCClark
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times, on business. My company pays so I cannot comment on value. However what is clear from my own experience and that of colleagues is that the hotel has a widely varying standard of room and it appears to be entirely random which you get. This explains the mixed reviews on this site I suspect! At worst its a small box room with the wardrobe pushed up against the bed, and tired decor Many rooms have electrical arrangements that would fail a UK safety inspection big time, with exposed wiring (held together with insulating tape) in the bathroom, as well as multi-way adapters plugged into multi-way adapters to give sufficient electrical sockets. This is considered a major source of house fires by the fire brigade in the UK!! Any effort to get a room change is met by a shrug and dont bother asking to see the duty manager because there isnt one - so the reception staff say. Checking in is a laborious process using an iPad style computer tablet - but it takes ages. Breakfast at 30EUR gives you an idea of the philosophy at this hotel - rip off the tourist for as much as you can as quick as you can perhaps?

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location and great price”
Reviews.Author: Donegal042
Reviews.Content: Don't let bad reviews here put you off as we could see no justification for them. Hotel was lovely, staff were pleasant and helpful. Food was excellent. Breakfast was perfect with little sun terrace available, (great for smokers). If it wasn't for a sign above the lap dancing club we would never have known it was there. Lovely, safe area and couldn't fault anything about it. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “value for money in a good location”
Reviews.Author: SJKBelfast
Reviews.Content: This hotel is probaby best described as tired. It is an old building with slightly warren like corridors, it has a reasonable level of decor. We arrived late due to a strike at the airport, we had booked a double classic room but were given a rather small twin room. The following morning we requested a move to a double room this was arranged for us with no real issues. The staff were very helpful. The room was comfortable, th ebathroom good, the TV antiquated but satisfactory. We had booked breakfast thiscould not be described bas anything special but was more than adequate. The hotel is well situated and a short walk from most of the major attactions. There is an abundance of local eating places nearby. The reception staff were very helpful in advising us on where to eat etc. Their recommendations were spot on. So in summary a old building which will always struggle to have that 5 star quality but it was warm, comfortable, very good value for money (booked through Otel.com) very well situated, with a helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful room, rude staff”
Reviews.Author: scottc621
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really amazing the minute you walk into it. It is beautifully decorated and the room was spacious which is unusual for Italy. We enjoyed the location but it was a bit loud at times since our room overlooked the neighboring Hard Rock Cafe. I felt for a 5 star hotel we should have recieved better service. Although there were exceptions, most of the people at the Front Desk were unfriendly and not helpful. Also at breakfast, we felt like we were intruding and they did not make us feel welcome at all. We were able to overlook these things as we really did enjoy our room and our location.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly disappointing...not a five star hotel”
Reviews.Author: N-G-B-G
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for one week with my fiance, it was booked as a special trip, and I cannot put into words how bitterly disappointing our experience was. We had requested a room with a view, the first room we were given was very large (unusual for Rome) but shabbily and sparsely furnished, and looked like an old storage facility that had been made into a room. I wish we had taken pictures as it's difficult to describe - there was an ancient cracked mirror on one wall, a huge uncomfortable bed and a crooked glass light fitting that looked like it had been bought at a jumble sale - the only thing that was remotely five star was that we were given bathrobes. As we were staying there for a week we asked to be moved to another room - we are not fussy people and never complain and debated for ages before we decided to do this. It was supposed to be five star experience after all and was a special trip. When we went to reception and when they realised we were staying for a week they agreed straight away to move us - they said they only had similar rooms but that the next day 80 people were leaving so they could give us something better. The next morning we had to remind them about this and they said they would move our bags for us and that they could guarantee this room would be better - go out and enjoy Rome. It wasn't. To be fair it had a view - of the Chica Chica Boom strip club next door... The second room was much smaller and was on a corner - it had a carpet this time so that was an improvement. It had very basic, old and shabby furniture, and a bathroom that had more mold on the ceiling than I have ever seen in my life, it was everywhere. You could see where they had tried to wipe some of it off but it was so bad that hadn't made any difference as it was all over. As I said, we're not complainers so were too embarrassed to ask to be moved again. I honestly wish we had said something - I wouldn't live like this at home and can't express how awful it was to shower in there. We spent very little time in the hotel room, it just wasn't somewhere you would enjoy spending time. The breakfast was fine but along the lines of what I would expect anywhere. Some of the serving staff were very nice but the weekend staff were rude, barging in front of you to get through the door and generally not happy to be there. The only additional thing they had to a normal breakfast was Prosecco - a bit too early for me but a nice touch. Our travel plans changed and we had to leave a day early, we had paid in advance (to the hotel directly) but they wouldn't give us a refund as we had pre-paid. Save your money, book a good four star - we had hotel envy and spent our trip looking into the doors of neighbouring hotels. Rome is beautiful, go there, just stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION EXCELLENT STAFF”
Reviews.Author: PATRICIA7171
Reviews.Content: Was in Rome two times before, this was the best hotel yet. I loved the location. We were able to walk to the Spanish Steps and Trievi Fountain. The staff was amazing, we were treated as if we were the only ones there, real personal attention.

Reviews.Title: “The level of service brings this hotel down in ratings!”
Reviews.Author: seasonedtraveler03
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three nights. From the first moment we arrived I knew there was going to be a problem with our room. Someone was already complaining at the front desk about their room and when I asked if my room request for 2 beds had been honored, they said yes. When we got to the room there was only one bed, not two. When I went down to the front desk there was yet another guest complaining about their room. The staff at the front desk was not at all service oriented. They acted like they didn't care what you paid for your room or what your request was. They really didn’t want to be bothered. They spoke/understood very little English or pretended not to. And this hotel for the size and money did not have a Concierge so you were left to the lazy, low quality men at the front desk when you needed to ask a question. On top of all of this the beds were the worst I’ve ever experienced in the 20+ years of traveling around the world. For the rating of this hotel, we were shocked. The bed, pillows and sheets must have been decades old. I would not stay here for any reason. There were no redeeming qualities, the staff was rude and not helpful, and it was not situated conveniently to the main attractions in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful city, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: rcbp
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. We stay with promotional rate, good cost benefic relation. Bedrooms are bigger, the jacuzzi was nice at night, after a long walk by the city. If we return to Rome we will stay in this hotel if maintain the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Nice friendly clean hotel but not 5 star in my view”
Reviews.Author: Coolatree
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff are friendly and helpful. Myself and my sister have stayed in 5 star hotels in London / New York and Dubai and this is not 5 star, more like a 3 / 4 star. Saying that the hotel is 5 minutes from the Spanish steps and 10 minutes walk from the Trevi Fountain. The hotel is situated beside the Hard Rock cafe and around the corner from the USA Embassy on the Via Veneto which is the street which features in La Dolce Vita .....Breakfast is included however you will need to ask for toast as they do not advertise the fact that they have toast....breakfast finishes bang on time......From Fiuminico airport we paid a flat rate of E45 for our taxi....o

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: beverley c
Reviews.Content: this is not what I would expect from a 5 star luxury hotel, the first room we were shown the floor was dirty the furniture was old (not antique) and scratched the bathroom had hairs in it, the second room was in a very noisy position, we settled on the third room, mostly cleaner but still not what should be expected. Small things missing , no tissues, poor toiletries, no kettle or hospitality tray. The good aspect is that the hotel is in a good position and served a decent breakfast, but for the money paid I would not recommend this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a short stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: LSK09
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at the Ambasciatori Palace for two nights last week. The room and bath were large and comfortable. The warm welcome was appreciated and the service was excellent. The brunch was the best I have ever had in Rome with excellent waiter service. The location is within a few minutes walk of all the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Thrilled”
Reviews.Author: rapunzel2Nj
Reviews.Content: I was very nervous about staying in hotels overseas, bc i had heard horror stories of European standards. This hotel was wonderful. Our room was spacious (there were three of us, husband, daughter and myself) and there was more than enough room for all of us and a day bed. The bathroom was spacious and elegant. The staff sends you to restaurants that are English friendly (meaning- menus in English as well as Italian) Room was quiet and i slept like a baby. That is all i need. Wonderful place. Very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: PatrickGib
Reviews.Content: Warm and friendly greeting from all the staff. Room was spotless and just right. Barman Marco friendly and very helpful. Many thanks to Vicenze all of you for making our stay such a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and superb location”
Reviews.Author: Thinfire
Reviews.Content: Great location for conferences at the nearby embassies. Front desk staff always ready to help and assist. Nice breakfast. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Where camera can be removed from locked room while at dinner”
Reviews.Author: brnsrgn
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel. Staff very helpful. Interestingly we asked concierge for dinner recommendation, which was excellent. However, while we were at dinner $3500 worth of camera equipment was stolen from our locked room!!!! We went to police station in Rome as instructed, nice experience, not. Hotel said insurance would cover the loss. After returning to states, Hotel would NEVER return emails or phone calls. Each time I called, they assured me something would be done. Never got a dime from them. Either stay away, or don't bring valuables to this hotel. Also bottled water was almost $20 per bottle!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: baltimore7123
Reviews.Content: Staff was very helpful thru out our stay. Rooms were clean and well furnished. Hotel provided a free wheelchair for a member of our group during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: bostonlight
Reviews.Content: I was nervous about staying here after reading reviews. I thought the hotel was lovely and the service fantastic. The location was fabulous too. The rooms were very large and the bathrooms were modern and clean. The only negative was the bedding was a bit tired and the sheets were rough. The breakfast buffet was impressive and certainly not your typical European (continental) spread. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel has the charm and location”
Reviews.Author: jeckert16
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a portion of our honeymoon. Our room was pretty spacious and furnished nicely. Our room/suite overlooked the street with a double balcony. Yes you could hear the street noise with the doors opened, but this street is probably why you chose to stay at the hotel. Overall, it's a great location, especially if you arrive by train. Keep in mind that most hotels in europe are very different from those in the united states, meaning a four or five star european hotel will differ from what one would expect in the states. Of course, if you're that concerned with how plush the hotel room is, you're not focusing on the real reason of why you're there. You do not necessarily need to use public transportation. Walk everywhere if you're able. During your travels, find that wonderful, hole in the wall tratoria to have lunch in. It's not only the history that makes Rome great...the Romans and the neighborhoods in between the sights contribute just as much.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, very mixed quality”
Reviews.Author: LemonadeJoe
Reviews.Content: I would never pay out of my own pocket for this hotel. Very mixed impressions: a fairly classy lobby but a shabby reception area, room just about good size, plush carpet but worn out furniture. Soundproofing poor, street noise fairly strong. But a very spacious and comfortable bathroom. Service partly useless (I was told there was no possibility of internet connection in the room, later discovered they had a cable hidden behind TV and, yes, it was possible to get a paid connection), but on other occasions people were very attentive - especially the breakfast staff was great. Then again: location is GREAT, and, hey, it's Rome, so unless it's really bad you tend to forget the smaller annoyances quickly, all that remains are the impressions of the city and the food.

Reviews.Title: “they robbed us!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tfele
Reviews.Content: my nightmare !!!!!!!!!!!!! during the day of my 37th birthday somebody took all the money that was in the room's safebox!!!!! and left my netbook fortunately.....it was certainely an inside job as the safe was locked with the some code after the robbery..... worse of all that the hotel did nothing for us and as I heard it was not the first time, the police only bothered to write my statement .... please beware or you will end up robbed!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dolce Vita in Rome still alive”
Reviews.Author: LenaSleptsova
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel 7 nights, 12-19 November for leisure (usually we visit Milano for shopping but decided to add something new to our common trip). Booked two rooms (deluxe) through Moscow agent. As we'd had an early flight we arrived about 11am. I thought we would have to leave our lagguge and wait for check-in time (2pm) but receptionist checked the system and accommodated us immediately. It was funny: they still have original room keys - not the electronic cards (I'm collecting them through over the world). Hotel in my opinion should percieve as one of other 5* hotels in Rome: there are a lot of 5* like the Ambasciatori Palace - a litle bit old but still nice. From the first sight looks more as 4* but it's worth 5*: remember! it was the ambassadors residence, so nobel atmospthera, modest but with advantage. Rooms were pretty good: enough spacious, bathrooms're in very good condition - all marble, clean, new, double sink, bathroom amenities. Unfortunately they did not provides robes and slippers, and I'm not sure they priveded the turn down service in night. They have internet (cable) in all rooms - 15 euros per day, more than easy to connect. They have king size bed, multy lingual TV. Monibar is not really expencive (not chip, of course, but not too high prices). The breakfast is good - american: hot dishes on buffet - scramble eggs and bacon, but if you ask for any special omlets there was no additional charge. They have american cofee as usual drink but you can ask for espresso or cappuccino - no charge. Not all waiters at the restaurant spoke English fluently but if they didn't understand what you want they called somebody fluent in English. They have tipical italian food for breakfast - pomodoro cherry, mozzarella, spumante! (Italian champagne)/ Staff were very polite and friendly, all times ready to help. Almost all days they had seminars and conferencies, but on weekend they opend special hall in lobby with fireplace - very nice. Last day of our stay there were filming at the hotel - I think about "Dolce vita" times - all actress with 60-s hair-do, jueverllies etc. The location is really perfect - 2 minutes to Piazza Barberini, about 5 minutes walking to Spanish Steps, 5-8 minutes by foot to Fontana di Trevi, about 12-15 to Piazza Navona, 5-6 piazza Respublika. US embassy right opposite. There are a lot of good restaurants around, a lot of shops, cafe ets. They did not have iron in the room but ironed our cloths in 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “3 Star OK for Pleasure Travel, Not Business”
Reviews.Author: elb9803
Reviews.Content: Positive: Bathrooms are nice and spacious. Centrally located to tourrist sites and pretty lobby. Average: Continental european breakfast. Negative: Bedrooms are outdated - carpet is worn and sheets are scratchy. Had to have the room amenities fixed - cable not plugged in, phone service went out although neither operator nor front desk realized this and connected a colleague to my room over a 4 hour period as if phone service was working. No wireless internet or gym.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: peterharwich
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate on this Hotel and the Room was lovely, Staff were excellent and the breakfast was very good. It had a very slightly faded feel (I do mean this as a compliment!) but still very elegant. Would stay here again, the location is very good as well !

Reviews.Title: “great stay and service”
Reviews.Author: genebeans
