Reviews.Content: We just left two days ago and had two rooms on the third floor and they were 332 and our room was 327. I don,t understand all the complaints about this hotel as the rooms were done twice a day. they had great rates on line and all things promised were delivered including pickups and drop offs. We could find no fault after staying at many five star hotels. I agree this is more a four star but we really would not hesitate to stay there again as the staff is friendly and helpful and when we needed a taxi they got it within two minutes. The hotel is very clean. We did not eat there other than breakfast which was more than adequate.Go pay three times more at other hotels in the area but there is no reason to do so unless you just want the snob appeal. This is also very casual in attire..We had no problems at all and anyone can send me a message with any questions..Gene

Reviews.Title: “A/C and Ant problems”
Reviews.Author: fulya1313
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights 4 days at this hotel.. if you plan to go on summer time, wont recommend this hotel at all . Air conditioning unit is so noisy , you feel like plane is taking off every second ..I told to reception, they said will look at it but nothing had been repaired during our stay. We had to open the window to get cool air and my husband end up catching cold . Also bathroom didint have ventilator or window .. it was very humid , i am assuming due to humid conditions , there were ants on the floor .. later i found some in my bed . I also informed to reception desk , they smiled .. i said " so you know you have this problem " they said ants may come from windows.. I was at 6th . I asked them to use some sort of threatment to get rid of at least during our stay .. Again, they promised to look into it , but didint see any improvement. I had 3 big itchy red spots on my leg , i am not sure bcs of ants or mosquitos .. Bath tub was jacuzi but i would suprise if anyone can use it seeing the mold inside the tub . There were some leak to floor everytime we took showers , cleaning personel should have seen it if they clean the bathrooms everyday . Reception desk people were friendly and nice. Locationwise is very good , can walk to everywhere .. within 15 - 20 mins. distance.. Will we stay again ? Dont think so.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: Zara08
Reviews.Content: This hotel meet all our expectations. We saw it the last time we were in Rome and my wife fell in love with it. We had a corner room with lovely views. It had clearly been completely redecorated recently and was in mint condition. The only negative was a noisy air conditioning unit. As it was going to be a major job to fix it the hotel offerred to move us to another room but we elected to stay put and sleep with the window open. Not too much noise at this tiome of year. The room was large and spacous. The breakfast was excellent in quality and quantity, Staff were attentive at all times. OK it is not your typical English or USA breakfast but certainly exceeds Europens standards. The front staff were an absolute delight. They were polite and helpful at all times. This hotel is an old but graciuos one and we would certainly be staying here again ast is in such a good location, away from the tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Expected More for the Money”
Reviews.Author: 3crows
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and I expected more from such an expensive hotel. The breakfast had runny scrambled eggs, no sliced meat, cereal, yogart, and something close to turkey bacon that was weird. The room was very warm and we had to sleep with the window and patio door open which explained why the housekeepers left us earplugs because the NOISE from outside was LOUD. Why does a former palace that charges 500e (as noted on the back door) not have air conditioning or even a fan to circulate air in the room?? The front staff was very helpful however and the bathroom was large and clean.

Reviews.Title: “mixed review”
Reviews.Author: edelmacd
Reviews.Content: having stayed at this hotel we have mixed feelings positives: bathroom, spacious room, lovely grand entrance reception area and lounge, location close to trevi fountain and spanish steps negatives: room could do with updating, air conditioning didnt work well

Reviews.Title: “Perfect position”
Reviews.Author: ascot69
Reviews.Content: Ambasciatori Palace is a 5 stars hotel in Rome. It's in front of USA Embassy, via Veneto, the heart of the "sixties" Dolce Vita. Now the street is full of medium quality / expensive restaurants and it's not so trendy. The structure is large and well cleaned with a large number of meeting rooms. Rooms are quite good, bedrooms ok, bathrooms below a 5 stars average. Breakfast as well is not at averager due to the cost (you could buy the room with no breakfast included, and DO IT 'cause it usually costs 25/30 Euro, and there are a large number of bars outside the hotel when you can have the same food and coffee for 5 euro...)

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: tonia123
Reviews.Content: Excellent location! The hotel staff was very kind and helpful. The room was nice and the bathroom very spacious. I can assume that this hotel has enjoyed moments of glory some decades ago, but I suggest it needs some refurbishment. Nonetheless it is more than decent and reasonably priced for Rome standards, only a bit worn out. Breakfast is a bit poor for a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: kfsquire
Reviews.Content: When? My wife and I visited Rome in December '07. This hotel is located on the Via Veneto -- a quaint street near several restaurants, shops and other hotels. Its also situated in a good location for walking to many sites of interest. The hotel was nicely decorated for Christmas. Checking In: We were very well greeted by the doorman and hotel staff. Our check-in process was smooth and fast, without any line or delay (although this may have been due to the time of year we were visiting; the hotel was empty). Nevertheless, the hotel staff was friendly, knowledgeable, and spoke Engllsh. As expected, the check-in process involved the doorman, the bellman, the representative behind the counter (all of whom I felt obliged to tip). The Room: We had a standard room with a Queen size bed. We did not have a view of the Via Veneto; we had an exterior room in the back of the hotel, so our view was not so nice. The room was clean. The furnishings and decor were european as expected. Thread counts on the bed and pillows were adequate. The bathroom was nicely appointed with marble and various soups and toiletries. The shower/bath was large but oddly no shower curtain: this resulted in quite a flood of the bathroom floor each morning. The room was equiped with internet access and this was great for me. I was able to check my business email, instant message family at night, etc. I did not have converter for my AC plug and the hotel staff provided me with one for the duration of our stay. The Restaurant: Our hotel package included breakfast each morning. The full buffet each morning was just fine for our needs: scrambled eggs, bacon, assorted cereals, fresh fruit, and fresh baked items. There was a full wait staff as well to provide coffee, tee or capuccino. The staff was always friendly. Miscellaneous: The hotel had a full service bar in the lobby, although we always made a point of staying out of the hotel until the evening since we didnt go to Rome to stay in the hotel. Also, the place was "dead" -- this must have been based on the time of year. Overall, I would recommend this hotel as a quiet, clean hotel with a good location and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Much Better Than Previous Reviews--A Very Good Hotel & Staff”
Reviews.Author: DanielCincy
Reviews.Content: I brought a group of 30 people from my Company to Rome for a global meeting in May. I got worried when I read the reviews on this site and even stopped off at the hotel prior to the meetings during a separate trip to Europe. I found the previous reviews to be overly negative and not accurate. This hotel is very nice by Rome standards and the staff went out of their way to help us. I would call it a 4 star by American and Northern European standards vs. its 5 star in Rome. The rooms were comfortable, the location superb on the Via Veneto, and the Concierge was worth his weight in gold. I would recommend this hotel and believe that the only way to do better is to go for one of the very most expensive hotels in Rome eg Sofitel or one of the boutique hotels.

Reviews.Title: “loved hotel”
Reviews.Author: IrelandBrian
Reviews.Content: Had booked this hotel as a special birthday treat for my husband without reading reviews...when I finally read them 3 days before we were due to arrive, I tried to change hotel as reviews not very good, but no joy as all hotels booked out....SO glad...hotel was excellent very large room with our own balcony and sitting area...staff friendly and breakfast fine..location of hotel great. I would highly recommend this hotel and hope that we will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Felt Like a Queen in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ERigby
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great location. It's walking distance to the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps and a short walk to the subway to get anywhere else. When we walked into the fabulous lobby, the gloved doorman held the door for us and we felt like royalty. The front desk was very professional, friendly and helpful. The first floor of the hotel is beautiful with several impressive rooms. Our room was huge, much bigger than anticipated with a small balcony looking over the street. Bathroom was large as well and everything was clean. We had an issue with out TV and the front desk sent someone up to fix it right away. Food at their restaurant was great and breaskfast was really good. Cons: Nothing, really. Bottom Line: We'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Dusty...”
Reviews.Author: Nico1611
Reviews.Content: Well...I know this was nearly two years ago, but it crossed my mind I should share my experience of the Ambasciatori Palace. Let me get this straight: this, by all OLD Italian standards, is a five star hotel - super rococo large rooms (even two bathrooms and a big balcony in our suite), old-fashioned staff, outrageous prices, excellent location. By recent ones, however, it is merely a comfortable superior three stars hotel: no room service (or lobby bar or anything other than the night watchguy hanging around in a "wifebeater") after 11pm, no business serice ("Oh, you want the Internet! There's a big Internet café 200 meters down there"...), no fitness room, mediocre old-style Italian breakfast, old and dusty interiors (litteraly dusty...), musical water pipes, etc. Not worth the money you'll be paying for it - better try elsewhere...

Reviews.Title: “Not 5* by UK standards but pretty good”
Reviews.Author: Mini1Edinburgh
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through a travel company before we checked the reviews. Needless to say we were a bit apprehensive . However found the reception staff very helpful and as own restaurant was closed on Sunday when we arrived, recommended where to eat and provided map with directions etc. Room was large and bright and very clean. Chambermaid was efficient and friendly, indeed all staff whether just passing in the corridors or at reception/door acknowledged us with a smile or greeting. Breakfasts were good - all the usual stuff, cereals, juices rolls, fresh fruit etc and some cooked items. Had one evening meal in the hotel which was pricey but the quality of the food was well worth it. I would agree with previous reviews re the price of the drinks at the bar and also the mini bar in the room - excessively expensive. This is not 5* by UK standards but very pleasant to stay in and definately no where near as bad as previous reviews have stated. Perhaps upgrading has taken place and the staff have been sent on customer care courses!! On the whole we enjoyed our stay here, the hotel is in a nice area which is central for walking to most of the attractions. I believe if you are friendly and courteous to the staff they will respond in the same way to you.

Reviews.Title: “5 star situation, 3 star facilities!”
Reviews.Author: doc50
Reviews.Content: Shame this hotel has so much going for it, but misses out for lack of effort! It is in an excellent position right on the Via Veneto, just around the corner from the US embassy, walking range of all the major sights. Air conditioning and a safe in the room, breakfast certainly enough! Staff helpful and friendly, but not the 5 star class of a US or UK hotel. Room a good size but bare dark walls and view of another wall, curtains more of sunscreen not very efficient black out. All looked old and in need of upgrade. DO NOT have drinks from bar, at 34 euros for 2 G+T we needed to go elsewhere for another to recover. If you get this hotel in a package it is ok, if choosing yourself spend the money somewhere else, 5 star price and 3 star class.

Reviews.Title: “So and So!!”
Reviews.Author: CanadaJerry
Reviews.Content: I must agree with other review, this hotel need some rennovations!! Anyway, the room I've beeen assigned was spacious and clean even if not so modern. The breakfast was fine, bakery in particular. The location is terrific, just in the middle of via veneto and close to mny fine restaurants. I don't know if I would reccomend this hotel or not, but homestly is not such a disaster as described.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Accomodations - poor food”
Reviews.Author: TravelLoversAL
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here in late April 2007 and apparently missed most of the renovation problems that others have mentioned here. We felt that all public areas were very nice, and enjoyed the piano playing in the bar. The staff was helpful in booking a tour, taxis, etc. Although I do not remember the name of the young doorman who worked afternoons, he was very helpful in all areas, banks, restaurants, etc. We felt that a couple of the staff members at the desk were somewhat stuffy, but most were nice. We booked a double room and got a king size very clean room with a new, clean bathroom. There were floor to ceiling french doors with a very very small balcony where we could lean out and get fresh air. We opened these at night for fresh air as it was quite cool outside at night and early in the morning. We had plenty of closet space and a small foyer which separated our room from the hallway. Breakfast was included in our bill and as we are not big breakfast eaters we did use this service. The eggs and bacon were somewhat undercooked, but we were able to pick some that was mostly cooked. Cereals, fruits, breads and juices were provided and the staff was very friendly. We had the best coffee at breakfast here than anywhere in Rome. It was served very hot in a china pot (several cups) with a separate china pitcher of warm milk. We tried dinner in the hotel one night. We both like to try new things but could not eat the appetizer and could not even bear to taste the swordfish. We were charged 69euros for the water we drank and the hard, chewy bread. Via Venetto is a very nice, quite street with several sidewalk cafe's and a lovely gellato and pastry bar about two blocks away. We ate at a nice little pizza place about two blocks from the hotel on the opposite side and just around a curve - headed toward Barbarini Ave on the recommendations of the young doorman. The greek salads were very large and tasty. We attempted to order two slices of pizza and received two 24" pizzas but they were very good. We felt very safe walking in this area at any time of the day. Although, we did not get a chance to use it because of our tours, there was a hop-on hop-off red bus stop right across the street. After booking, we looked into some bed and breakfasts but had waited too late, so we did feel like we paid a little much here than usual, but it was our 40th anniversary and we wanted something special.

HotelInfo.Name: Ambasciatori Palace Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Vittorio Veneto 62, 00187 Rome, Italy
